Description: Provides subsidized meals at ₹10 for the poor through designated meal centers.
Eligibility Criteria: Available to all needy individuals in Maharashtra.
Application Process: Visit Shiv Bhojan centers between 11:00 AM to 3:00 PM.
Additional Notes: Each center has a daily plate limit.

Scheme Name: Mahatma Jyotiba Phule Shetkari Karj Mafi Yojana
Description: Waives crop loans up to ₹2 lakh for eligible farmers to relieve debt burden.
Eligibility Criteria: Farmers with outstanding loans as of Sept 30, 2019. Govt employees & elected representatives are not eligible.
Application Process: No application required; loan waiver is processed automatically.
Additional Notes: Regular loan repayers may receive incentives.

Scheme Name: CIDCO Vastuvihar Celebration & Unnati Housing Scheme
Description: Offers affordable housing in Navi Mumbai via a lottery system for EWS & LIG.
Eligibility Criteria: Must belong to EWS/LIG category and be a Maharashtra resident.
Additional Notes: Ensures fair housing distribution.

Description: Integrates job search, skill development & self-employment for unemployed individuals.
Eligibility Criteria: Open to unemployed residents of Maharashtra.
Additional Notes: Covers job seekers, skill training, and entrepreneurship.

Description: Provides ₹51,000 per year for SC & Nav Bauddha students for education & lodging.
Eligibility Criteria: SC or Nav Bauddha category, income < ₹2.5 lakh per year, Class 11 & above students.
Additional Notes: Supports higher education for underprivileged students.

Description: Prevents allocation of multiple government houses to the same family.
Eligibility Criteria: Applicant & immediate family must not own another govt-allotted house.
Application Process: Verification at the time of application.
Additional Notes: Exceptions may apply to rehabilitation schemes.

Description: Promotes entrepreneurship in MSME sector by providing financial aid.
Subsidy Amount: Up to ₹50 lakh for manufacturing, ₹10 lakh for services
Eligibility Criteria: Open to individuals, institutions, co-ops, SHGs, trusts.
Additional Notes: Aims to create 10 lakh jobs over 5 years.

Description: Provides subsidized LPG connections to low-income households.
Eligibility Criteria: Families without existing LPG, preference for BPL households.
Gender Criteria: Connection issued in name of female family member.
Application Process: Apply via designated LPG distribution centers.
Additional Notes: Promotes smoke-free cooking.

Scheme Name: Hinduhridaysamrat Balasaheb Thackeray Anna-rath (Shiv Thali Scheme)
Description: Mobile canteens provide ₹10 meals to poor individuals.
Eligibility Criteria: Open to all needy individuals, meals via mobile vans.
Additional Notes: Follows models from Tamil Nadu, Andhra Pradesh, Karnataka.

Description: Provides smart cards for construction workers to access social security schemes.
Eligibility Criteria: Construction workers with a 90-day work certificate; must register with Maharashtra Labour Welfare Board.
Additional Notes: Requires ₹25 fee + ₹1 monthly deposit for 5 years.

Description: Replaces the Atta-Dal scheme with smart ration cards for 1.41 crore beneficiaries, enabling seamless food grain withdrawal through e-PoS machines and biometric authentication.
Eligibility Criteria: Resident of Punjab; eligible under NFSA or additional 9 lakh state-funded beneficiaries not covered under NFSA.
Additional Notes: Ensures intra-state portability and enhanced transparency.

Scheme Name: Punjab Apni Gaddi Apna Rozgar Scheme 2020
Description: Provides subsidies on vehicle purchases to enable self-employment for unemployed youth in Punjab.
Subsidy Amount: Up to INR 75,000 for four-wheelers or INR 50,000 for three-wheelers (15% of vehicle cost).
Eligibility Criteria: Resident of the district where applying; aged 21-45 years; valid commercial driving license; 30% reserved for SC applicants.
Additional Notes: Registration under the Punjab Ghar-Ghar Rozgar Yojana is required.

Scheme Name: Punjab Free Smartphone Scheme (Captain Smart Connect Scheme 2020)
Description: Distributes free smartphones with 4G data for a year to class 11th and 12th students from economically weaker backgrounds.
Eligibility Criteria: Resident of Punjab; studying in class 11th or 12th in a government school; household income less than INR 6 lakh per annum; must not already own a smartphone.
Additional Notes: Targets digital access and connectivity for students.

Description: Connects unemployed candidates with job opportunities through the Ghar Ghar Rozgar Portal, facilitating placements in government and private sectors.
Eligibility Criteria: Resident of Punjab; open to all job seekers registering on the official portal.
Additional Notes: Includes skill training initiatives.

Scheme Name: 1 Lakh Plots for Homeless Dalit Families Scheme (2019)
Description: Provides residential plots of 1,300 sq. ft. to homeless Dalit families in two phases, prioritizing villages with available panchayat land.
Eligibility Criteria: Homeless Scheduled Caste (SC) families in Punjab; selection based on availability of panchayat land.
Additional Notes: Focuses on improving living conditions for Dalit families.

Scheme Name: Punjab Farm Loan Waiver Scheme (Karza Mafi) - Phase 3 (2018)
Description: Offers loan waivers to small and marginal farmers to reduce financial distress.
Subsidy Amount: Waives outstanding loans taken from cooperative or commercial banks.
Eligibility Criteria: Farmers with landholdings between 2.5 to 5 acres; loans from cooperative or commercial banks.
Additional Notes: Targets financial relief for farmers in distress.

Scheme Name: Mahatma Gandhi Sarbat Sehat Bima Yojana (MGSSBY) 2019
Description: Provides cashless medical treatment up to ₹5 lakh per annum, merging Sarbat Sehat Bima Yojana with Ayushman Bharat (PMJAY).
Subsidy Amount: Up to ₹5 lakh per family annually for medical treatment.
Eligibility Criteria: Covers PMJAY-listed families and additional families funded by the Punjab government (46 lakh families). Includes pre- and post-hospitalization coverage (3 days before and 15 days after hospitalization).
Additional Notes: Aims at universal health coverage across the state.

Description: Focuses on rural infrastructure improvement in health, education, sanitation, and environment with a budget of ₹384 crore.
Eligibility Criteria: Applicable to all villages in Punjab; projects approved based on proposals from local development officers.
Additional Notes: Integrates multiple governmental schemes for rural development.

Description: Universal health insurance scheme offering cashless treatment up to ₹5 lakh per family annually across government and empanelled private hospitals in Punjab.
Subsidy Amount: Up to ₹5 lakh per family annually for medical treatment.
Eligibility Criteria: Covers PMJAY beneficiaries, blue card holders, registered farmers, construction workers, and other poor families (43.18 lakh families). No restriction on family size.
Additional Notes: Expands healthcare access without financial burden on families.

Description: Employment generation initiative under "Ghar Ghar Rozgar and Karobar," ensuring job opportunities for urban youth through government/private/self-employment sectors.
Eligibility Criteria: Unemployed urban youth of Punjab; selection based on job fairs and placement drives organized under the scheme.

Scheme Name: Rajasthan Medhavi Chatra Muft Scooty Vitaran Yojana
Description: Provides free scooters to 6,000 meritorious tribal girls to encourage education and reduce dropout rates.
Eligibility Criteria: Meritorious tribal girls in Rajasthan; must meet academic excellence criteria and be enrolled in a recognized school.
Additional Notes: Promotes higher education among tribal girls.

Scheme Name: Rajasthan Priyadarshini & Mohan Lal Sukhadia Housing Schemes
Description: Affordable housing schemes offering residential plots in Jaipur through online and offline applications.
Eligibility Criteria: Open to all homebuyers; must comply with JDA regulations and complete the application process.
Additional Notes: Plots located in Muhana Village (Priyadarshini) and Dahmi Khurd Village (Mohan Lal Sukhadia).

Description: Provides financial assistance to senior citizens for economic security.
Eligibility Criteria: Domicile of Rajasthan; women aged 55-75 receive ₹750/month, above 75 receive ₹1,000/month; men aged 58-75 receive ₹750/month, above 75 receive ₹1,000/month; annual family income ≤ ₹48,000.
Additional Notes: Targets economic support for senior citizens.

Description: Simplifies business setup for new entrepreneurs by removing prior approvals and exempting inspections for three years.
Eligibility Criteria: Open to new MSMEs in Rajasthan; must register on the Raj Udyog Mitra portal and commence operations after March 4, 2019.
Additional Notes: Encourages entrepreneurship and MSME growth.

Description: Unifies service delivery through a single Jan Aadhaar card for efficient distribution of welfare benefits like healthcare, food security, and financial inclusion.
Eligibility Criteria: Resident of Rajasthan; families must register for a Jan Aadhaar card to avail government schemes.
Additional Notes: Replaces the earlier Bhamashah scheme for better transparency and efficiency in welfare distribution.

Description: Provides unemployment allowance to jobless youth while promoting skill development programs.
Eligibility Criteria: Resident of Rajasthan; age 21-35 years; must have completed at least 12th grade and hold a graduate/postgraduate degree; annual family income ≤ ₹3 lakh; unemployed and registered with an employment exchange.
Additional Notes: Aims to support unemployed youth financially while boosting employability through skill development initiatives.

Scheme Name: Rajasthan Priyadarshini Indira Gandhi Mahila Shakti Yojana
Description: Supports women entrepreneurs with funding, skill training, and rehabilitation for women in distress.
Subsidy Amount: ₹1,000 crore allocated for funding ventures, education, and training programs.
Eligibility Criteria: Women residing in Rajasthan; interested in starting enterprises or undergoing skill training; victimized women eligible for rehabilitation support.
Additional Notes: Promotes women empowerment through entrepreneurship and skill development initiatives.

Description: Provides one lakh jobs to unemployed youth over five years through loans for self-employment and skill development programs.
Subsidy Amount: Loans up to ₹1 lakh for self-employment initiatives.
Eligibility Criteria: Unemployed youth residing in Rajasthan; loans available through RIICO, RFC, and finance corporations for SC/ST/OBC/minorities intending to start businesses.
Additional Notes: Focuses on entrepreneurship development among unemployed youth in the state.

Description: Health awareness campaign educating the public about diseases, vaccination programs, and drug addiction through a dedicated website and call center.
Eligibility Criteria: Open to all residents of Rajasthan; no specific income or demographic restrictions.

Scheme Name: Athikadavu Avinashi Groundwater Recharge & Drinking Water Supply Scheme
Description: Recharges groundwater and supplies drinking water through a 1,058 km pipeline network, benefiting 1,048 water bodies.
Eligibility Criteria: Households in Tamil Nadu for drinking water; farmers in Erode, Tirupur, and Coimbatore for irrigation.
Additional Notes: Enhances water availability for irrigation and drinking purposes.

Description: Conducts a decennial survey to assess the socio-economic status of marine fisherfolk.
Eligibility Criteria: Marine fisherfolk in Tamil Nadu.
Additional Notes: Helps formulate welfare schemes for the fishing community.

Scheme Name: TN Amma Ilaignar Vilayattu Thittam (Amma Youth Sports Scheme)
Description: Promotes sports development among youth by constructing sports grounds and providing financial support.
Eligibility Criteria: Youths in rural and urban Tamil Nadu.
Additional Notes: Encourages sports participation and leadership among youth.

Scheme Name: Tamil Nadu Supply Chain Management Scheme
Description: Enhances post-harvest processing and logistics for farmers through infrastructure development.
Eligibility Criteria: Farmers in identified districts: Krishnagiri, Dharmapuri, Coimbatore, The Nilgiris, Tiruchirapalli, Dindigul, Theni, Ramanathapuram, Thoothukudi, and Tirunelveli.
Additional Notes: Supports market integration and reduces post-harvest losses.

Description: Provides monetary grants and essential items to ration cardholders during Pongal.
Eligibility Criteria: Ration cardholders in Tamil Nadu.
Additional Notes: Includes items like raw rice, jaggery, and clothing.

Scheme Name: Tamil Nadu Amma Water Bottles Scheme
Description: Offers affordable glass water bottles to reduce plastic waste.
Eligibility Criteria: General public, especially commuters.
Additional Notes: Promotes eco-friendly practices.

Scheme Name: Tamil Nadu Amma Free Cow / Sheep / Goat Scheme
Description: Supports animal husbandry by providing livestock to economically weaker sections.
Eligibility Criteria: Women in rural Tamil Nadu, prioritizing SC/ST and BPL families.
Additional Notes: Includes insurance and other support for beneficiaries.

Description: Provides free shoes and socks to students in government schools.
Eligibility Criteria: Students in Classes 6 to 10 in government schools.
Additional Notes: Enhances school attendance and hygiene.

Scheme Name: Tamil Nadu Free Laptop Scheme (for Government School Teachers)
Description: Offers laptops to government school teachers for digital education.
Eligibility Criteria: Government and government-aided school teachers.
Additional Notes: Supports digital learning initiatives.

Description: Distributes free bicycles to Class 11 students in government schools.
Eligibility Criteria: Students in Class 11 in government schools.
Additional Notes: Encourages school attendance and transportation.

Description: Provides ₹5,000 per acre per season to farmers for agricultural inputs like seeds and fertilizers.
Eligibility Criteria: Farmers owning agricultural land in Telangana; tenant farmers are excluded.
Application Process: Bank account details required for direct benefit transfer.
Additional Notes: Aims to reduce reliance on moneylenders and ensure timely investment in farming activities.

Description: Offers financial assistance to elderly, widows, disabled individuals, and economically weaker sections.
Subsidy Amount: ₹2,016 for most categories; ₹3,016 for disabled individuals
Eligibility Criteria: Resident of Telangana; annual income below ₹1.5 lakh (rural) or ₹2 lakh (urban); excludes those owning large landholdings or involved in government service.
Additional Notes: Targets vulnerable groups for social security.

Description: Supports fishermen by providing subsidies for fish seed, nets, boats, and hatchery setups to boost fisheries production.
Subsidy Amount: Subsidies on fish seed, nets, boats, etc.
Eligibility Criteria: Fishermen and fish farmers in Telangana eligible for subsidies on inputs like fish seed, boats, nets, and transport vehicles.
Additional Notes: Enhances livelihoods of fishermen and boosts fisheries sector growth.

Description: Provides financial assistance for the marriage of women from economically weaker sections.
Eligibility Criteria: Resident of Telangana; girl must be 18+ at marriage; income limits apply based on community and rural/urban location; special provisions for disabled women.
Application Process: Online application required with supporting documents.
Additional Notes: Encourages financial support for marriage in disadvantaged communities.

Description: Distributes free health and hygiene kits to girl students in government schools from Class 7 to 12.
Eligibility Criteria: Girls studying in government schools from Class 7 to Class 12 in Telangana.
Additional Notes: Promotes hygiene and health awareness among schoolgirls.

Description: Ensures year-round water supply to farmlands, drinking water for Hyderabad, and industrial water needs through lift irrigation systems.
Eligibility Criteria: Farmers and industries in Telangana; water allocation based on agricultural, industrial, and drinking needs.
Additional Notes: One of the world’s largest multi-stage lift irrigation projects.

Description: Promotes dairy farming by providing subsidies for buffalo purchases and incentives for milk production.
Eligibility Criteria: Farmers purchasing buffaloes through dairy development societies; SC/ST farmers eligible for higher subsidy rates; incentives of ₹4 per liter of milk produced are also provided.
Application Process: Implemented through dairy societies like Vijaya Dairy and Mulkanur Dairy.
Additional Notes: Aims to boost milk production and reduce dependency on imports from other states.

Description: Provides free housing units to low-income families under the Dignity Housing Scheme merged with PMAY funding.
Eligibility Criteria: BPL families with a valid ration card; property registered in the name of women beneficiaries; applicant must not own property under any other housing scheme.
Application Process: Application through local authorities or PMAY portal.
Additional Notes: Encourages female homeownership while addressing housing shortages among low-income families.

Description: Waives off agricultural loans up to ₹1 lakh taken before December 11, 2018 to provide financial relief to farmers.
Eligibility Criteria: Farmers with outstanding crop loans taken before December 11, 2018; excludes commercial or non-agricultural loans; must be a resident of Telangana.
Application Process: Automatic processing based on loan records with banks/government agencies.
Additional Notes: Aims to reduce financial distress among farmers by clearing loan burdens.

Description: Provides ration cards to eligible families for subsidized food under NFSA.
Eligibility Criteria: Resident of Jharkhand, BPL/APL classification under NFSA.
Application Process: Apply through the official portal with necessary documents.
Additional Notes: Ensures food security for weaker sections.

Scheme Name: Jharkhand Free LPG Cylinders Refill Scheme
Description: Offers free LPG cylinder refills to PMUY beneficiaries to promote clean cooking fuel.
Eligibility Criteria: PMUY beneficiary, resident of Jharkhand, BPL family with LPG connection under PMUY.
Application Process: Apply via gas distributor; subsidy reimbursed through DBT.
Additional Notes: Includes distribution of 12 lakh new LPG connections.

Description: Provides ₹1,000 monthly pension to senior citizens, widows, and persons with disabilities.
Eligibility Criteria: Resident of Jharkhand, senior citizen (60+), widow, or person with disability registered under social schemes.
Application Process: Register under the respective social security scheme.
Additional Notes: Increased from ₹600 to ₹1,000 for financial support.

Description: Financial aid for girls from birth to adulthood to promote education and prevent child marriage.
Eligibility Criteria: Resident of Jharkhand, financially weaker family, girl must remain unmarried till 20 years of age.
Application Process: Apply through local government offices or online portal.
Additional Notes: Distributed via DBT as the girl progresses in education.

Description: Ensures fair pricing for farmers by purchasing paddy at ₹1,750 per quintal (MSP).
Eligibility Criteria: Paddy farmers in Jharkhand registered with procurement centers.
Application Process: Register with procurement centers; payment via NEFT/RTGS/DBT modes.
Additional Notes: Promotes financial stability for farmers.

Description: Provides ₹5,000 per acre annually to small and marginal farmers for Kharif crops.
Eligibility Criteria: Resident farmer in Jharkhand with landholding less than 5 acres; applicable for Kharif crops only.
Application Process: Apply through agriculture department offices or online portal.
Additional Notes: Reduces dependence on loans and boosts production.

Description: Provides medical kits to rural health workers (Sahiyas) to improve local healthcare access.
Eligibility Criteria: Rural residents; Sahiyas are primary beneficiaries equipped for healthcare services delivery.
Application Process: Distributed through local health departments and Sahiyas networks.
Additional Notes: Reduces need for travel to urban centers for minor treatments.

Description: Offers interest-free loans to farmers if repaid within a year; includes 50% subsidy on dairy farming.
Eligibility Criteria: Resident farmer in Jharkhand; must repay loan within one year; additional benefits for dairy farming sector.
Application Process: Apply through agricultural banks or cooperative societies in the state.
Additional Notes: Promotes White Revolution and financial stability among farmers.

Scheme Name: Jharkhand SC/ST Civil Seva Protsahan Yojana
Description: Provides ₹1 lakh assistance to SC/ST students clearing UPSC prelims for mains preparation.
Eligibility Criteria: SC/ST category resident of Jharkhand; annual family income below ₹2.5 lakh; cleared UPSC prelims exam.
Application Process: Apply through social welfare department or online portal with required documents and proof of eligibility.
Additional Notes: Encourages SC/ST students to pursue civil services careers by easing financial burdens during preparation.

Description: Provides free coaching to 30 meritorious science students for IIT/JEE and MBBS entrance exams.
Eligibility Criteria: Science stream students; merit-based; economically weaker sections
Application Process: Selection based on merit and reservation policy
Additional Notes: Modeled after Super 30 initiative.

Description: Provides cashless healthcare up to â‚¹5 lakh for poor citizens at empanelled hospitals.
Eligibility Criteria: Economically weaker sections; not listed in SECC 2011
Application Process: Beneficiaries receive e-cards for availing treatment
Additional Notes: Expands coverage beyond Ayushman Bharat scheme.

Description: Provides free domestic water connections to all households in Tripura.
Subsidy Amount: Full subsidy on domestic water connections
Eligibility Criteria: All households in Tripura
Additional Notes: Tribute to Atal Bihari Vajpayee.

Scheme Name: Scheme to Distribute Cows to 5000 Families
Description: Provides two cows per family to improve income and dairy production.
Eligibility Criteria: Poor families in Tripura; must engage in dairy production
Additional Notes: Aims to make Tripura self-sufficient in milk production.

Description: Engages citizens in governance through online discussions and feedback.
Eligibility Criteria: Open to all residents of Tripura
Additional Notes: Enhances transparency and public involvement.

Description: Provides interest subsidies on loans for B.Ed trainee teachers.
Eligibility Criteria: Enrolled in NAAC-accredited B.Ed colleges; must take loans
Additional Notes: Addresses shortage of trained teachers.

Description: Allows female government employees to take up to 730 days of paid child care leave.
Eligibility Criteria: Female government employees with up to two children
Application Process: Leave can be availed once in service period
Additional Notes: Ensures financial security while caring for children.

Description: Provides free LPG connections to BPL households.
Eligibility Criteria: BPL category; name in SECC 2011 data
Additional Notes: Replaces traditional fuels to improve health.

Description: Allows citizens to check and download voter ID cards.
Eligibility Criteria: Residents of Tripura; registered voters
Application Process: Online check via CEO Tripura website
Additional Notes: Ensures transparency in voter registration.

Description: Free laptops for meritorious Class 10 & 12 students from BPL families.
Eligibility Criteria: Uttarakhand residents, Class 10 & 12, BPL, 80%+ marks
Additional Notes: Encourages academic excellence

Description: Free IAS/PCS coaching for 300 SC/ST students from weak financial backgrounds.
Eligibility Criteria: SC/ST, economically weak
Additional Notes: 5-month coaching program

Description: ₹5 lakh per family for cashless hospitalization at empanelled hospitals.
Eligibility Criteria: All Uttarakhand families in SECC 2011 data
Additional Notes: Covers pre-existing conditions

Description: Provides subsidized food grains and access to welfare schemes.
Eligibility Criteria: Uttarakhand residents, APL/BPL/Antyodaya
Additional Notes: Process made digital

Description: Online voter list access and voter ID download.
Eligibility Criteria: Uttarakhand residents, 18+ years
Additional Notes: Ensures election transparency

Description: Provides nutritious milk once a week to students under the Mid-Day Meal Scheme.
Eligibility Criteria: Class 1-8 students in government schools
Additional Notes: Aims to combat malnutrition

Description: Soft loans up to ₹1 lakh at 2% interest for small/marginal farmers.
Eligibility Criteria: Small and marginal farmers
Additional Notes: Must repay within 3 years

Description: Free 100-hour coaching for JEE/CPMT for 100 meritorious girls.
Eligibility Criteria: Class 12 girls from 95 blocks of Uttarakhand
Additional Notes: Inspired by Super 30 initiative

Description: Cashless health insurance for govt employees & pensioners in empanelled hospitals.
Eligibility Criteria: State govt employees & pensioners
Additional Notes: OPD coverage included

Description: Regulates groundwater extraction; mandates registration of pumps and rainwater harvesting.
Eligibility Criteria: Farmers and domestic users exempt from fees; urban landlords must install rainwater harvesting.
Additional Notes: Violators face fines and penalties.

Description: Provides internships and stipends for skill development in students.
Eligibility Criteria: Students in class 10th, 12th, or graduation.
Additional Notes: Internship duration: 6 months - 1 year.

Description: Farmers can clear electricity bills in installments with interest waiver.
Eligibility Criteria: Only for UP farmers; dues must be cleared in 6 installments.
Additional Notes: Timely payments ensure interest waivers.

Scheme Name: UP Mukhyamantri Krishak Durghatna Kalyan Yojana 2020
Description: Financial assistance for farmers’ families in case of death or disability.
Eligibility Criteria: Farmers and their families (18-70 years); Bataidars (tenant farmers) also eligible.
Application Process: Apply within 45 days of the incident.
Additional Notes: Replaces an older insurance scheme.

Scheme Name: UP One District One Product Scheme
Description: Supports district-specific industries with financial aid, training, and market access.
Eligibility Criteria: Entrepreneurs and artisans in designated product sectors.
Additional Notes: Promotes local employment and global trade.

Scheme Name: UP Mukhyamantri Kisan & Sarvhit Bima Yojana
Description: Insurance scheme for farmers against accidental death/disability.
Eligibility Criteria: Farmers with family income ≤ ₹75,000; must be registered in land records.
Additional Notes: Covers accidents, drowning, and disasters.

Description: Quick online electricity connections for BPL/APL families.
Eligibility Criteria: BPL: ₹10 fee; APL: ₹100 fee for 1-25 KW connection.
Additional Notes: Aimed at hassle-free electricity access.

Description: Provides financial assistance to support girl education and well-being.
Eligibility Criteria: Girl child born in UP, support from birth to graduation.
Additional Notes: Linked with Beti Bachao Beti Padhao.

Scheme Name: Pradhan Mantri Krishi Sinchai Yojana (PMKSY) – UP Implementation
Description: Offers irrigation subsidies for water conservation and increased productivity.
Eligibility Criteria: Farmers in UP; must choose pre-approved suppliers.
Additional Notes: Enhances irrigation efficiency.

Description: Large-scale afforestation drive planting 22 crore trees.
Eligibility Criteria: Open to all UP residents.
Additional Notes: Geotagging tracks progress; involves schools & villages.

Description: Free social security scheme providing Provident Fund (PF) and financial aid for unorganized sector workers.
Eligibility Criteria: Residents of WB; landless laborers & unorganized workers; must be registered under SSY.
Additional Notes: Government bears the full cost.

Description: Free electricity for families consuming ≤75 units per quarter.
Eligibility Criteria: WB residents; households consuming ≤75 units per quarter.
Additional Notes: Supports financially weaker families.

Description: Provides housing for tea garden workers.
Eligibility Criteria: Must be a tea garden worker; must not own a house.
Additional Notes: Improves workers’ living conditions.

Description: Pension scheme for SC individuals not receiving other pensions.
Eligibility Criteria: Must belong to SC category; must be above 60; should not receive other pensions.
Additional Notes: Supports elderly SC individuals.

Description: Pension scheme for ST individuals not receiving other pensions.
Eligibility Criteria: Must belong to ST category; must be above 60; should not receive other pensions.
Additional Notes: Supports elderly ST individuals.

Description: Provides loans for unemployed youth to start businesses.
Eligibility Criteria: WB residents; unemployed; must have completed 10th/12th grade.
Additional Notes: Encourages entrepreneurship.

Description: Financial aid for minority students (Class 1 to Ph.D.).
Eligibility Criteria: Must be a minority; WB domicile; 50%+ marks in last exam; income ≤₹2-2.5 lakh.
Additional Notes: Covers pre-matric, post-matric, and merit-cum-means scholarships.

Description: Free crop insurance for farmers against weather-related losses.
Eligibility Criteria: Farmers in WB; cultivating covered crops; both loan-taking & non-loan-taking farmers eligible.
Additional Notes: In collaboration with Agriculture Insurance Company of India.

Description: Financial aid of ₹5,000 per acre/year for farmers + ₹2 lakh death benefit.
Eligibility Criteria: Must be a farmer in WB; age 18-60 years for death benefit.
Additional Notes: Direct income support for farmers.

Description: Financial aid for young entrepreneurs to start businesses.
Eligibility Criteria: WB residents; must have a technical degree/diploma; interested in entrepreneurship.
Additional Notes: Supports self-employment.

Description: Relief fund to assist individuals affected by natural disasters, medical emergencies, or other crises.
Eligibility Criteria: Residents of Andhra Pradesh affected by calamities or emergencies.
Application Process: Donations can be made online at the official website.
Additional Notes: Contributions are tax-exempt under Section 80G.

Description: Financial assistance for unemployed youth to pursue skill development and reduce family burden.
Eligibility Criteria: Unemployed youth aged 22–35 years; residents of Andhra Pradesh; not enrolled in Provident Fund; Aadhaar-linked bank account required.
Application Process: Apply online via the official website or mobile app.
Additional Notes: Skill training is also provided to beneficiaries.

Description: Distribution of mother kits to women post-delivery in government hospitals to promote institutional deliveries.
Eligibility Criteria: Pregnant women delivering in government hospitals in Andhra Pradesh.
Application Process: No application required; kits distributed directly at hospitals.
Additional Notes: Aimed at reducing child mortality and promoting institutional deliveries.

Description: Provides high-protein food to pregnant women and children under 6 years to combat malnutrition.
Eligibility Criteria: Pregnant women and children under 6 years residing in Andhra Pradesh.
Application Process: Administered directly through Anganwadi centers and government programs.
Additional Notes: Pilot program targeting malnutrition reduction and infant mortality prevention.

Description: Financial assistance for SC/ST/OBC/Disabled students in classes 5–10 for education expenses.
Eligibility Criteria: Students from SC/ST/OBC/Disabled categories; annual family income below ₹2 lakh; residents of Andhra Pradesh; Aadhaar card required.
Application Process: Apply online at the official portal with required documents (e.g., Aadhaar, income certificate).
Additional Notes: Funds credited directly to students' bank accounts.

Description: Financial aid for auto, taxi, and maxi cab owner-drivers for vehicle maintenance costs.
Eligibility Criteria: Auto/taxi/maxi cab owner-drivers who are residents of Andhra Pradesh.
Application Process: Apply online through the designated portal or mobile app.
Additional Notes: Aimed at improving livelihood for self-employed drivers.

Description: Monthly stipend for junior advocates and lawyers during their initial practice years.
Eligibility Criteria: Junior advocates under 35 years old; registered with State Bar Council under Section 17 of Advocacy Act, 1961; actively practicing law; residents of Andhra Pradesh; only one family member eligible at a time; owning a four-wheeler disqualifies.
Application Process: Submit applications with required documentation (e.g., affidavit confirming practice) through designated channels.
Additional Notes: Aimed at supporting young lawyers financially during their foundational years in practice.

Description: Financial aid for women from Kapu, Balija, Telaga, and Ontari communities to improve economic stability.
Eligibility Criteria: Women aged 45–60 years from eligible communities; residents of Andhra Pradesh.
Application Process: Applications submitted via official portals with supporting documents (e.g., community certificate).
Additional Notes: Empowering women economically from marginalized communities.

Description: Provides 100% fee reimbursement for economically weaker students pursuing higher education.
Eligibility Criteria: Residents of Andhra Pradesh with annual family income < ₹2.5 lakh, specific landholding limits, and enrolled in eligible courses. Excludes income taxpayers and students in private universities or management quota.
Application Process: Apply online/offline through Navasakam Beneficiary Management Portal.
Additional Notes: Amount transferred to mothers' bank accounts.

Description: Recruits volunteers to deliver welfare schemes directly to beneficiaries' doorsteps.
Eligibility Criteria: Residents of Andhra Pradesh belonging to the village/ward applied for; educational qualifications: 12th pass (plain areas), 10th pass (agency areas).
Application Process: Apply online at gswsvolunteer.apcfss.in by filling out the application form and uploading required documents.
Additional Notes: Aims to enhance transparency and eliminate corruption.

Description: Financial assistance for hostel and mess charges for students pursuing ITI, Polytechnic, or Degree.
Eligibility Criteria: Residents of Andhra Pradesh; ITI, Polytechnic, or Degree students. Amount disbursed in two installments directly to mothers' bank accounts.
Application Process: Apply online through the scheme's official website by registering and uploading required documents.
Additional Notes: Beneficiaries include over 58,091 students across 153 colleges.

Description: Platform for collaboration and contributions toward development projects in Andhra Pradesh.
Eligibility Criteria: Open to individuals, organizations, corporations, and philanthropists willing to contribute funds or expertise towards state projects.
Application Process: Access the portal at connect.ap.gov.in to register and participate in development projects.
Additional Notes: Ensures transparency and monitoring of externally funded projects.

Application Process: Application through the Education Department or respective educational institutions.
Additional Notes: Encourages higher education among girls.

Description: Provides ration cards to eligible citizens under the National Food Security Act (NFSA) for access to subsidized food grains and essential commodities.
Subsidy Amount: Subsidized food grains as per NFSA guidelines
Eligibility Criteria: Permanent residents of Bihar; categorized into APL, BPL, and AAY based on economic status; required documentation includes proof of residence, identification, and income details.
Application Process: Application through the Public Distribution System (PDS) or respective local authorities.
Additional Notes: Ration card serves as an important document for availing various government welfare schemes.

Description: Provides financial assistance of ₹1,000 per month to educated but unemployed youth to support their livelihood during job search.
Eligibility Criteria: Permanent residents of Bihar; unemployed; annual family income not exceeding ₹3 lakh; must have passed 12th grade with a graduation or post-graduation degree.
Application Process: Application through the District Registration and Counseling Center (DRCC) or online portal.
Additional Notes: Aims to help jobless youth improve their skills and sustain themselves financially.

Description: Provides a pension of ₹400 per month to eligible senior citizens aged 60 years and above to help them become self-reliant.
Eligibility Criteria: Permanent residents of Bihar; aged 60 years or older; applicable to all castes, religions, and communities; excludes retired government pensioners.
Application Process: Application through the Social Welfare Department or online portal.
Additional Notes: Priority given to senior citizens below the poverty line (BPL).

Scheme Name: Pradhan Mantri Kisan Samman Nidhi Yojana (PM-KISAN) – Bihar
Description: Provides financial assistance of ₹6,000 per year to eligible small and marginal farmers, distributed in three equal installments.
Eligibility Criteria: Permanent residents of Bihar; small or marginal farmers; Aadhaar card mandatory; excludes retired government employees, income tax payers, and institutional landholders.
Application Process: Application through the Bihar Agriculture Portal or local agriculture offices.
Additional Notes: Supports farmers in meeting agricultural and household expenses.

Scheme Name: Bihar Education Loan Waiver for Students under Student Credit Card (SCC) Scheme
Description: Waives education loans for students who fail to secure employment after completing their professional courses; employed students repay loans in 82 installments.
Subsidy Amount: Up to ₹4 lakh interest-free loan; 1% interest rate for differently-abled, transgender, and female students
Eligibility Criteria: Permanent residents of Bihar; Class 12th pass for higher education loans; Class 10th pass for polytechnic courses; unemployed after course completion for loan waiver; employed students repay in installments.
Application Process: Application through the Education Department or respective financial institutions.
Additional Notes: Encourages higher education by providing financial support and reducing the burden of loan repayment.

Scheme Name: Bihar Mukhyamantri Kanya Utthan Yojana – Graduation Incentive for Girls
Description: Provides a one-time financial incentive of ₹25,000 to every girl who completes her graduation to promote higher education among women.
Eligibility Criteria: Permanent residents of Bihar; must have completed graduation from a recognized institution on or after FY 2018; applicable to both married and unmarried girls; no restrictions based on caste, community, or religion.
Application Process: Application through the Education Department or respective educational institutions.
Additional Notes: Approximately 1.2 lakh girls benefit each year.

Scheme Name: Bihar Online Land Mutation & Land Tax Payment Facility
Description: Provides an online platform for land mutation (Dakhil Kharij), payment of land tax, and linking of district registration offices with circle offices to improve transparency and efficiency in land-related processes.
Eligibility Criteria: Available to all landowners and property holders in Bihar; must have legal ownership of land; applicable to new landowners, inheritance cases, or land transfer cases.
Application Process: Services accessible through the official property registration website.
Additional Notes: Aims to reduce land disputes by streamlining land-related processes.

Description: Online application system for new ration cards, name inclusion, and status checks.
Eligibility Criteria: Resident of Goa, 18+, head of family, no duplicate ration card in another state.
Additional Notes: Essential for availing subsidized food grains.

Description: Provides ₹1 lakh to eligible girls for marriage or essential expenses.
Eligibility Criteria: Resident of Goa or studied up to Class 10 in Goa, 18-40 years, parents’ income < ₹8 lakh.
Application Process: Apply through Women & Child Development Dept.
Additional Notes: Aims to reduce financial burden on families.

Description: Online job registration for employment seekers and laborers.
Eligibility Criteria: Residents of Goa seeking employment.
Additional Notes: Includes Labour & Employment (L&E) Card.

Description: Loan assistance for house repair, renovation, or reconstruction.
Eligibility Criteria: ST applicants with own house, age up to 55 (58 for govt. employees), two guarantors required.
Application Process: Apply through Goa State Scheduled Tribes Finance Corp.
Additional Notes: Previously ₹2 lakh, revised in 2019.

Description: Free laptops for Class 11 students, owned by schools.
Eligibility Criteria: Resident of Goa, enrolled in Class 11 (Arts, Science, Commerce).
Application Process: Schools distribute; students must return after Class 12.
Additional Notes: Students liable for damage.

Description: Financial incentive for inter-caste marriages.
Eligibility Criteria: One spouse must belong to SC category, couple must register marriage & live together for 1 year.
Additional Notes: Money deposited as FD with a 3-year lock-in period.

Description: Life insurance for fishermen against accidental death.
Eligibility Criteria: Resident of Goa (15+ years), fisherman, aged 18-50, member of Fisheries Co-op Society.
Additional Notes: Requires good health certificate.

Description: Provides subsidized coconuts to stabilize prices.
Eligibility Criteria: Goa resident, purchase limit of 30 coconuts/month, must show LPG card.
Application Process: Purchase from Goa State Horticulture Ltd.
Additional Notes: Govt. covers transportation & margin costs.

Description: Digital support for farmers with weather updates, market prices, etc.
Eligibility Criteria: Resident of Goa, farmer.
Additional Notes: Part of Digital India initiative.

Description: This scheme offers an electricity duty waiver to industrial units, streamlining the approval process to reduce clearance time from six months to 24 hours.
Eligibility Criteria:
- Industrial units operating in Gujarat.
- Compliance with state electricity regulations.
- Submission of required documents through the CEICED portal.
- Valid for businesses meeting specified power usage criteria.
Application Process: Applications are submitted online through the CEICED portal.
Additional Notes: Part of Gujarat's efforts to promote industrial growth and ease of doing business.

Description: A crop insurance scheme protecting farmers against natural calamities, allowing online applications, premium calculations, and status checks via the iKhedut portal.
Eligibility Criteria:
- Open to all farmers in Gujarat.
- Loanee farmers: mandatory application.
- Non-loanee farmers: voluntary application.
- Application before specified crop deadlines.
Application Process: Applications are processed online through the iKhedut portal.
Additional Notes: Aims to provide financial support to farmers in the event of crop loss due to unforeseen events.

Description: Provides subsidized tablets to meritorious students to enhance digital education. Eligible students receive a branded tablet by paying a nominal fee.
Eligibility Criteria:
- Permanent residents of Gujarat.
- Secured merit in the 12th class.
- Enrolling in the first year of college or a polytechnic course.
Application Process: Eligible students can apply through their respective educational institutions or designated online platforms.
Additional Notes: Aims to bridge the digital divide and promote e-learning among students.

Description: Financial assistance program promoting education and welfare of girl children, providing monetary incentives at different educational stages and upon reaching adulthood.
Eligibility Criteria:
- Girl child must be a permanent resident of Gujarat.
- Applicable to the first and second daughters of a family.
- Annual family income must be below ₹2 lakh.
Application Process: Applications can be submitted through the Women and Child Development Department's official portal or at designated government offices.
Additional Notes: Encourages the education and empowerment of girls in the state.

Description: Facilitates the establishment of new CNG stations through a franchisee and OMC-dealer model, aiming to increase the number of CNG stations in urban and highway areas.
Eligibility Criteria:
- Open to individuals and entities interested in setting up a CNG station.
- Ownership of land for station setup.
- Compliance with Gujarat Gas Company Ltd (GGCL) and Sabarmati Gas Ltd (SGL) regulations.
Application Process: Interested parties can apply through the official portals of GGCL or SGL, following the specified guidelines and procedures.
Additional Notes: Supports the expansion of CNG infrastructure to promote cleaner fuel alternatives.

Scheme Name: Bhulekh Naksha – Gujarat Land Records System
Description: Provides online access to land records through the AnyROR portal, allowing citizens to check land details, survey numbers, ownership records, and revenue case data without visiting government offices.
Eligibility Criteria:
- Open to all citizens of Gujarat.
- Users must provide valid land details such as survey number or khata number.
- Landowners can apply for digital copies of their records through the portal.
Application Process: Users can access land records by visiting the AnyROR portal and entering the required land details.
Additional Notes: Enhances transparency and accessibility of land records for the public.

Description: Issues ration cards under different categories (APL, BPL, NFSA, Non-NFSA) to provide subsidized food and essential commodities to eligible households through the Public Distribution System (PDS).
Eligibility Criteria:
- Permanent residents of Gujarat.
- Households without an existing ration card.
- Newly married couples and individuals with expired temporary ration cards.
- Eligibility determined based on household income and economic status.
Application Process: Applications can be submitted online through the Digital Gujarat portal or at local rationing offices.
Additional Notes: Ensures food security for economically weaker sections of society.

Scheme Name: Gujarat Voter List & ID Card Registration
Description: Facilitates online voter registration and voter list updates through the Chief Electoral Officer’s (CEO) portal, allowing citizens to download voter ID cards, check electoral details, and update records.
Eligibility Criteria:
- Indian citizen and permanent resident of Gujarat.
- At least 18 years old as per the eligibility cutoff date.
- Valid identity proof and address documentation.
Application Process: Citizens can register or update their details online through the CEO Gujarat portal.
Additional Notes: Aims to streamline the electoral process and encourage voter participation.

Description: Aims to promote education for Scheduled Caste (SC) girls by providing them with free bicycles, reducing dropout rates and improving access to secondary education.
Eligibility Criteria:
- Girl belonging to the SC category.
- Enrolled in the 9th standard in a government or government-aided school.
- Annual family income should not exceed ₹1.2 lakh (rural) or ₹1.5 lakh (urban).
Application Process: Schools identify eligible students and coordinate with the Social Justice and Empowerment Department for the distribution of bicycles.
Additional Notes: Encourages continued education among SC girls by addressing transportation challenges.

Scheme Name: Atal Bihari Vajpayee Shramik Avagaman Yojana
Description: Provides free bus passes for construction workers to travel via Haryana Roadways.
Eligibility Criteria: Must be a registered construction worker in Haryana with proof of employment.
Application Process: Apply through the Haryana Labour Welfare Board or local labor offices.
Additional Notes: Helps ease the financial burden of daily travel for laborers.

Description: Farmers receive compensation if horticultural crops are sold below MSP.
Eligibility Criteria: Farmers must register online at BBY portal, sell using J-Form, and upload transaction details.
Application Process: Registration on BBY portal before the deadline.
Additional Notes: Encourages crop diversification and reduces income risks.

Description: Connects job seekers with employers via an online job fair portal.
Eligibility Criteria: Must register on the official portal and apply for available vacancies.
Additional Notes: Aims to reduce unemployment and boost employment in the state.

Description: Free laptops for meritorious students scoring above 90% in Class 10 board exams.
Eligibility Criteria: Must be from Haryana government schools and scored 90%+ in Class 10 state board exams.
Application Process: Eligible students are selected automatically by the education board.
Additional Notes: Supports digital education for bright students.

Description: Online portal for farmers to register crop details for government procurement & benefits.
Eligibility Criteria: Farmers must register crops, submit land ownership documents, and meet deadline requirements.
Additional Notes: Ensures timely compensation and crop loss coverage.

Description: Provides Rs. 100 per quintal to small farmers who do not burn stubble.
Eligibility Criteria: Must own <5 acres of land and be a non-Basmati paddy farmer registered with the state agriculture dept.
Application Process: Apply via Haryana Agriculture Dept portal.
Additional Notes: Aims to reduce air pollution caused by stubble burning.

Description: Provides industry-led skill training & job placement under Haryana Skill Development Mission (HSDM).
Eligibility Criteria: Open to industries, training partners, and organizations offering NSQF-aligned training.
Additional Notes: Encourages apprenticeship-based learning for youth employment.

Scheme Name: Manohar Jyoti Solar Home Lighting System
Description: Solar home lighting systems for rural households without electricity.
Eligibility Criteria: Must be a rural household located at least 1 km away from the nearest village & without an electricity connection.
Application Process: Apply via Haryana Renewable Energy Department website.
Additional Notes: Promotes renewable energy adoption in rural areas.

Description: Offers training for obtaining heavy vehicle driving licenses.
Eligibility Criteria: Applicants must hold an LMV/LTV license, meet age criteria, and pay training fees.
Application Process: Apply online through Haryana Transport Department.
Additional Notes: Improves employment opportunities for commercial drivers.

Description: Online voter list for Haryana citizens to check their voter registration and download voter IDs.
Eligibility Criteria: Must be a registered voter in Haryana with a valid EPIC number.
Application Process: Access voter details on CEO Haryana Website.
Additional Notes: Ensures easy access to voter information ahead of elections.
